The economic woes that have plagued our great nation for far too long are a burden that I understand all too well. But let us be clear: the root of these problems is not the system, it's not the government, and it's certainly not the hardworking men and women who were born and raised on this soil. No, the true culprit behind our economic downturn is the influx of immigrants who have flooded our borders, taking our jobs, exploiting our resources, and draining our social services.

These immigrants, many of whom are here illegally, have no regard for our laws, our culture, or our way of life. They come to our country, they take what they want, and they give nothing back. They work for lower wages, undercutting our own citizens and driving down the standard of living for all of us. They fill our emergency rooms, our schools, and our prisons, straining our already overburdened systems to the breaking point.

My policies are not about hatred or intolerance; they are about fairness and justice. They are about putting the needs of our own citizens first, as it should be.
